newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria says UBS in group bid for CA.
newsitem.headline: Austria says UBS in group bid for CA.

text.p: Union Bank of Switzerland has joined an EA-Generali led group bidding for the Austrian government's Creditanstalt stake, the finance ministry said on Monday.
In a statement, it said that the EA-Generali group had joined rivals Bank Austria and entrepreneur Karl Wlaschek in bidding for the state's entire 70 percent of ordinary shares.
Austria says UBS in group bid for CA =2
The finance minstry said that UBS was helping to top up the consortium's bid so that it covered the government's entire stake.
The group, which also includes Commerzbank, Banca Commerciale Italiana and Austrian savings bank Die Erste, had bid for 74 percent of the government's 19.9 million shares.
Commerzbank, Belgium's Bacob, Banca Commerciale and Die Erste had joined UBS in putting forward extra cash.
The finance ministry said the successful bidder would probably face scrutiny by European Union cartel authorities.
It said it would evaluate the three bids but did not say when it expected to reach a final decision.
Austria says UBS in group bid for CA =3
According to the statement, UBS will contribute 27 percent of the additional money required for the remaining 26 percent of the state's Creditanstalt shares.
Commerzbank would contribute 33 percent, Bacob and Banca Commerciale 17 percent each and Die Erste six percent to the top-up.
The original 74 percent would be divided as follows: 40 percent Austrian companies and individuals, eight percent Austrian subsidiaries of foreign companies and 52 percent foreign companies.
Market leader Bank Austria submitted a bid for 100 percent of the governement's Creditanstalt stake as expected.
Former Billa supermarket chief Karl Wlaschek was a surprise entry.
